projects.notes:
Cast on 10, increase to 28 (56).

Heel - at base of the heel start increase ever row on back needle, k1 pm m1 k to last pm m1 k1 to double the stitches from 28 to 56. Short row - k to 1 before marker and wrap. P to 1 before marker and wrap. k to 6 before last wrap and wrap. P to 6 before last wrap and wrap. k to 3 before last wrap and wrap. P to 3 before last wrap and wrap. k 1 round picking up wraps. Start slip stitch heel flap.

Leg
Starting cables at the center back. Twist outward every other row on the back needle and every row on the front. Stitches that have been worked are transformed into 4 x 4 ribbing, starting with purl in the center back. When the cables meet in front that rib is worked as follows every other row with a k row in between:

Cable out - all knit
Cable in - purl back stitches
Cable cross right over left

repeated twice and then bind off with stretchy bind-off.
projects.name: I Aten't Dead

projects.notes:
Starting out with a short-row toe, provisional cast on of 26 stitches working my way down to 10 stitches.

Short row heels. I worked down to 6 stitches which made the heel really pointy looking.

About 1 inch of 2x2 ribbing at the top.
projects.name: Ruby Red Socks

projects.notes: Cast on 8 stitches and increased to 30. Short row heel with 12 stitches?
projects.name: Doctorin' my socks

projects.notes:
Kjerstie found another sweater in her stash with just the sleeves left to go and generously passed it on to me!

It is the perfect mindless knitting and should be a good fit for BoyCrafter next fall/winter

projects.notes: My son handed me a ball of yarn and requested a scarf. How could I not make one?
projects.name: Scarf by Request

projects.notes: My good friend Kjerstie gave me this sweater in progress to finish up for my son. It looks like it will be just perfect for this year and next. I’m hoping to have it ready for camping season! It will be great for the chilly evenings around the fire.
projects.name: Green grass and Blue Sky

projects.notes:
I had this beautiful ball of bulky yarn from Ewetopia’s CSA that just screamed to be made into mittens.

Got up to the decreases on the 11th and stopped. I need to make a few adjustments to the design so I ripped it.

projects.notes:
Just prototyping right now with some scrap yarn.

Turned out not at all what I expected.
projects.name: Experiment in Lace #1

projects.notes: A second try for a warm winter hat for my husband. A two layer hat with Fibonacci stripes. Provisional cast-on of 96 stitches. Square decrease at the crown.
projects.name: Two hats in one

projects.notes: I’m not sure this will end up being given away or if I will make something better but for now I am keeping it secret! Ssssshhhhhh

projects.notes:
I made these early on in my knitting days just as practice. Would love to swap them with someone if anybody wants them.

They are a cotton yarn twisted with a shiny thread. I have not tried blocking them. They are 2 variations of a simple feather and fan stitch pattern.
projects.name: Feather and Fan for Swap

projects.notes:
3/10 - playing around with some lace. This is my second try to make a certain look. I utterly failed the make that look but the results were still interesting…

3/14 - I tried a revised version of this and am really liking it. Starting to think this might really turn into a shawl.
projects.name: Experiment in Lace #2
Making it up as I go sock

projects.notes: The ugliest thing I have ever knitted. It belongs in the knitters hall of shame.
projects.name: WTF ::shrug::

projects.notes:
11/5 - Hope I have enough yardage. Ok note to self, really slippery yarn, big stitches and a standard size metal cable needle do not make for a relaxed knitting experience.

I’m not sure if the colors are manly enough for the the intended owner…this project has the potential to go really wrong but I am in denial about it right now.

11/8 - finished. The combination of slippery yarn, big needles and an unsuitable cable needle made for some sloppy stitches but it turned out pretty good. Will have to make sure it will fit the intended giftee though.
projects.name: Unoriginal hat

projects.notes:
I finally finished this project! This was my first time blocking lace and I have to say it really is like magic. The drape and the overall look was so much better after blocking. I love how this turned out although I find it a little on the scratchy side. I haven’t decided yet if I should keep it or put it into gift stash.

12/19/08 - I just dug this project out of the bottom of my yarn bin to find that I think I had been working the chart backwards?! Which is going to be hard since I have worked several charted projects since this one and somewhere I figured out how to really read charts.

projects.notes: Also very hard to see in the picture. It turned out cute but seemed like a lot of sewing for such a little thing.

projects.notes: I started by knitting a baby feet washcloth. Then I knitted another. Then I realized if I knitted some more I could make a blanket. I pretty much knitting one square a month during my pregnancy and this was the result. I did an awful job sewing the squares together and the whole thing turned out a little small.
projects.size: Kind of small for a blanket
projects.name: baby's blanket

projects.notes:
Modifications:
-Worsted weight on US8.
-Knitted 2 extra ridges before the button holes to give a little more room around the middle and a little more length.

The size came out bigger then I expected, more like a 2T, and it looks like this will fit my son! He is 3 years old but small.

projects.notes: I have knitted a couple of these and put them right to use. Sometime I should knit some more

projects.notes: I think I made the girl booties and I don’t think I did to well following the pattern.
projects.name: Booties

projects.notes: A very lovely pattern. It went really fast once I got past the first big chart!

Since it doesn’t look like i will have enough yarn to finish anyway I just frogged this. I don’t think I will have enough time to knit something for the baby it was intended for so I am planning to sew something instead.

projects.notes:
Using blue silver lined glass beads.

Ended up stopping a few rows short of the actual pattern because I wasn’t sure I would have enough yarn to finish. I think it still looks OK with out the extra lace though the edge doesn’t have as much weight to it without the extra beads.
projects.name: OMG it's full of stars!

projects.notes: The yarn is so wrong for this project and I totally did the size calculation wrong. The end result is horrible. It just fits all wrong!

projects.notes: I wanted to try a cable so I knitted the band off this hat.
projects.name: First cable

projects.notes:
I ran out of yarn about 8 to 10 rows before the end. Luckily bb55bb came to my rescue and sent me some more of this lovely mean girl yarn! I’m really happy with it. It’s big enough to keep my shoulders warm and very light!

I am knitting this as a Knit-a-long with my friend Kjerstie during the cruise we are going on at the end of January! We are both going to complete the garter section and then do the lace part on the cruise!

projects.notes:
9/21 - Finished knitting. Unblocked it is about 53 inches. It looks like it will gain a fair bit with blocking.

9/29 - It went up to 70 inches post blocking! The drape is much improved after blocking as well. I am really happy with it and hope my Father will be too. More pictures after it is gifted!

projects.notes:
My husband dubbed this the best 3/4 of a hat ever…

1/16 - I finished this and it is definitely an UGH. It’s too short and looks weird and I really didn’t enjoy knitting it.

I cast on 162 stitches but on US 8s. I am planning to switch to US 6s when I get to a nice length for a fold up brim. I’m planning to do a little improvising with the color pattern on the hat.
projects.name: Doubleknitski

projects.notes:
Not really following the pattern other then the cables. Working this toe-up. Started with a magic cast-on of 10 stitches, increased up to 52.

I tried a slip stitch heel flap this time and it turned out a little big on my foot. These socks are coming out kind of rugged. They seem like they will make good hiking or camping socks.

Finished sock 1 on 5/14 and started on sock 2.

Knit over half the second sock in one day. The only good thing about sitting in a hospital is the knitting time.
projects.name: Joan Grey, hot

projects.notes:
Would love to make this to wear this summer :)

5/21 - Just ordered yarn for this! Very excited.

5/24 - Got the yarn, hope to cast one soon.

6/5 - Started the increases today.

7/6 - knitting is finished, just need to weave in the ends and make the ties. I didn’t do the neckline as written. Instead I just knitted ribbing like for the arms so it has a rounded look instead of square.

KittyRiver put one finished fingerless glove and the yarn to finish the rest into the Traveling Hoar box. I took it out and am now finishing the other one.

Finally finished these. The one I knit is bigger then the other :) an excellent illustration of how gauge differs from knitter to knitter.

The sleeves seemed to take forever!

I did a little waist shaping and added button holes all the way down the front. I started this before I was pregnant and designed it so that I think it should be able to button once the baby is out. I’m 37 weeks in these pictures!

I look forward to wearing this sweater this fall and winter. It will definitely be nice and warm.

projects.notes: My first project using Magic Loop.

projects.notes:
These are at a smaller gauge then the pattern. I used 4 strands held together. This yarn says it is bulky but really is more like worsted.

I cast on 18 for the newborn size and 30 for the adult size. newborn size I kept knitting until the bonnet fit a dolls head with a little room and for the adult I used my head for the fit.
projects.name: Mother-Daughter Lyra Bonnets

projects.notes:
Cast off ripped and re-knit. The hat is great!

8/28 - Frak me! I cast off to tightly and can’t get it over my head! Fortunately there is a little yarn left and I can pick out the cast off and redo it with needles that are like 3 sizes bigger because I apparently can’t cast off loosely on my own.

8/19 - I started the 4 cable version initially but did far to many increases because I was temporarily insane. I then came to my senses and frogged it. I am now knitting the 8 cable version.
projects.name: Floozy Hat

projects.notes: used a bit of a partial skien and made these super cute hearts!
projects.name: Hearts!

projects.notes:
Started these toe-up magic cast-on of 28 stitches.

Sadly I think I am going to have to frog these!! I got about an inch up the cuff and the stitch pattern makes them just a little too tight, I am also getting a nasty looking gap at the sides. I wasn’t really digging the stitch pattern and I don’t think it was doing justice to the yarn.
projects.name: Mean Girl Socks - ribbed for her pleasure

projects.notes:
I am not sure at all of the yarn I used for this. I bought it on vacation in New Zealand and have lost the ball bands. It felted wonderfully and I consider this one of my favorite souvenirs of the trip.

I changed the pattern some to make the bag wider and shorter. I also played with the colors and directions of the design. My one wish is that I had knitted the top flap a little longer.
projects.name: Highland felted bag

projects.notes: This was the first sweater I ever attempted to knit. Some friends and I decided we would all knit the same sweater. We cast on together then vowed to get back together when we had all knitting the body up to the arm decreases. We never did get back together. About a year later I pulled it out and tried to finish it off. I had the wrong number of stitches so I fudged it. I didn’t understand the neck decreases in the pattern so I fudged that too. Then I did a really bad job seeming the whole thing up. The yarn is so thick and slippery. This sweater is almost bullet proof!
projects.name: First Sweater

projects.notes: This is my first and so far only sock. I intend to knit more socks someday but I don’t think I will knit the pair to this one since it is sooooo itchy I can’t stand to wear it.
projects.name: The first sock

projects.notes:
I made this hat for my son but I just sort of made up the pattern so it came out to big for him as a newborn. It looks like it will fit him this winter though and maybe for a couple winters after that.

I used the fibonacci sequence to come up with the pattern for the strips.
projects.name: Fibonacci stripe hat

projects.notes: Started swatching last night. I’m making these for Murk81’s baby who is finishing up a pair of socks for me. This is a swap from the Handmade Barter Group
projects.name: Shorties

projects.notes:
The holiday making has begun!

#1 finished 10/31
#2 finished 12/6

I had to alter the pattern to fit a smaller foot. Went down one needle size for a tighter gauge. I knitted toe up with a fleegle heel and removed one stitch from each of the cable sections to make the cuff a bit more fitting.

No pictures or pattern link until after Christmas!
projects.name: Solstice Surprise #1 - Kabuki Socks

projects.notes: I got the pattern along with the yarn in New Zealand at a out door market. The pattern said to knit the hat flat. I really should have knit it in the round. I messed up the decreases by decreasing every row instead of every other so the whole thing turned out short! My pom-pom is also pitiful.
projects.name: Beanie

projects.notes: Made for Fossettes in the rubbernecker mega swap of ‘09. The letters are done in glow in the dark fabric paint cause I suck at embroidery and glow in the dark anything is cool.
projects.name: disagreen gloves

projects.notes:
I really should have used smaller needles. I think a tighter gauge would really help to make this look sharper and hold it’s shape better.

I didn’t have enough contrast yarn for 3 fins so there are only 2.
projects.name: Um Rocket?

projects.notes: Made another one quick since my son claimed the first one when he saw it. This one I did on a size smaller needles. If I make any more I think I will still go down another needle size.
projects.name: Rocket too!

projects.notes: Very quick and I like it but there was a little less of the yarn I used then was ideal for the pattern so it turned out a little short. I have exceeded my flickr upload limit for the month so I can’t upload a picture until I either pay for unlimited uploads or next month rolls around…

projects.madeFor: My DH when he was still just my boyfriend

11/21 - First mitten finished.

I’m not really sure why these took so long to finish. I guess I just had less free time to knit them in then the last set of mittens I did.
projects.name: Mitered Mittens

projects.notes: Making some gauge modifications. Size 13 so smaller gauge so I am knitting the XL directions.
projects.name: Modern Garden Cardigan

projects.notes:
Mom’s birthday is in January…not sure I will have this finished by then.

2/9/08 - Nope didn’t make it for the birthday. It was so close but then the we got a stomach bug :( I finished the scarf just today and will give it to my Mother tomorrow!

It’s a really nice length scarf, amazing to get a scarf that long from just one skien!
projects.name: Birthday scarf

projects.notes: Sweet little knit! I will certainly be making more of these for myself and for gifts with all my leftover sock yarn. I ended up doing 13 repeats instead of the full number since my gauge is a little loose.
projects.name: A Little Something

projects.notes:
11/3 - Cast on and Cast off cozy #1. 50 Stitches, not knitting the bottom and am just starting with the ribbing. I did 4 rows of ribbing and then started the smocking chart. The cozy came out kind of small. It fits a normal mug but is a little more stretched then I would like so the next one will be bigger. I also didn’t like so much ribbing on top and bottom.

11/3 Cast on Cozy #2 with 66 Stitches. Started right in with the smocking to get a more smocked look.

11/5 Cast off Cozy #2. Looks good and I bought a couple of Mugs to gift with them. need to make a few more like #2 and find a good size mug for #1. I also ordered some cute winter theme buttons to go with these.

11/15 Cast on Cozy #3 with 66 Stitches to make
cozy #2.

11/17 finished cozy #3.
projects.name: Solstice Surprise #2 - Cozies!

projects.notes:
I love this yarn. So soft and the color reminds me of fall leaves.

This was a very quick knit and I love the result. It came out a little on the small side for my taste so next time I will either go up a needle size or add another pattern repeat.

I’m think adding a crochet edging. I think I used only a little more then 1/2 the skien for this hat!

12/8 - Started adding the crochet edging! My first attempt at crochet ever.
projects.name: Silky Hat of Choice

projects.notes:
Meet Myrtle’s feisty cousin Roxie.

Mods so far; Knitting the medium size and the body is this

K2, C, A, D, K19, F, K19, D, B, D, A, D, K19, F, K19, D, B, C, K2

Basically reducing in from 8 large lace panels to 4. In the hopes that I will finish it a little faster.

BEWARE THE WRONG SIDE ROW DECREASE!!!

Finished 11/19 - While this is definitely a lovely sweater I am not all that thrilled with how it looks on me. This is a sweater that looks best with a lot of negative ease. I did the medium size and probably could have gotten away with a small instead. The finished fabric is extremely stretchy.

I also had some issues with the shoulder decreases. As written I was just not getting a fast enough decrease but didn’t really realize this until halfway though. I then took measures to decrease the extra stitches quickly which lead to a poofy shoulder. If I made this again I would seriously consider not following the pattern for the shoulder decreases at all and just using a standard inset sleeve.
projects.name: Roxie

projects.notes: Still needs to be finished.
projects.name: Baby Kimono

projects.notes:
Day 15 - FINISHED!!!! I added an extra owl to the cuff of the left sleeve and cast off this evening HOORAY!!! I’m still trying to decide if I want to add button eyes to any of the owls or not.

Day 14 - Finished Right sleeve. Ended up doing only 15 rounds of ribbing and started the left sleeve. This is going to be close!

Day 13 - Almost done with the right arm, started the ribbing. I’m going to do 20 rounds of ribbing with plans to do an owl on the cuff of the left arm.

Day 12 - Right arm. 10 rounds = 2 inches in my gauge. I am knitting 10 rounds and then decreasing. About 1/2 way done.

Day 11 - Finished the body! It fits perfectly. I started the right arm but didn’t get very far.

Day 10 - not much time to knit. Still finishing the increasing.

Day 9 - Increasing, increasing, increasing!

Day 8 - Decreasing, increasing!

Day 7 - Decreasing, decreasing, Decreasing!

Day 6 - Knitted about 5 inches. I got a little nervous it wasn’t going to fit and I wasn’t sure when to start the decrease so I tried it on again. It fits great and it’s time to start the decreases!

Day 5 - Split the arms and am working down the body. Started my second ball of yarn and am trying to figure out where to start the waist shaping. I had a bit of a panic thinking it might be a little small, checked my gauge and I think I will be OK. It will be a close fitting sweater though.

Day 4 - finished the yoke, put it on scrap yarn to try it on. I marked the middle of the back short rows and then puzzled over the splitting math. I think I am going to go with 58 on the back, 36 for each sleeve and 50 on the front. I will cast on 4 stitches under each arm provisionally to get picked up later and knitted into the arm.

Day 3 - Almost through with the Owl cables!

Day 2 - Didn’t get much done, I needed to switch to a longer cable needle and didn’t have one on hand until the evening. I managed to knit down through the Owls heads.

Day 1 - Puzzled over how to do the short rows in reverse of the pattern. Think I figured it out.

Opening ceremony - Decided to attempt this top down instead of bottom up. Cast-on twice. Had to rip the first because I cast-on on circular needle that was too long but not long enough to magic loop!

2/1 - Got the yarn in the mail, need to wind it into cakes so I am all ready for the opening ceremonies!!!
projects.name: Olympic Owls

projects.notes:
Super quick and cute. I added an extra 10 row and a button hole to the body since my gauge was a wee bit smaller then the pattern.

Still need to block it and sew on the buttons.
projects.name: Little Wee Stone

projects.notes: last night I decided Baby Sister needed a pilot cap NOAW. Is this what nesting is?
projects.name: Sky Captain

projects.notes:
I just took the plug and play shawl design class with Amy Singer and had a blast! Here is what I worked up in class.

It is a modified wave pattern from a Japanese Stitch pattern book.

Working from the bottom up
Cast on 6
Increasing 2 stitches on every row
Using 2 charts that are mirror images and switching them after repeats so shawl is built like:

aaaaa
bbb
a
projects.name: Soft Waves

projects.notes:
2/8/08 - I finally pulled this out the other day after more then a year and started knitting on the arms. This is part of my effort to finish some stuff up because it’s February!

5/24 - Knitting is finished, I just need to sew the arms and do something about the neck. The neck is huge because I stopped way before the pattern said. I don’t like stuff around my neck.
projects.name: Portland Pullover

projects.notes: I knitted this on needles bigger then called for in the pattern not because I needed to to get the gauge right but because I was lazy and those were the needle I had on hand. This caused the sweater to come out large and sloppy. When my son crawls around the fronts get stuck under his knees and stretch WAY out.
projects.name: baby's sloppy sweater

projects.notes:
Came out a little extra slouchy because the yarn has a lot of weight to it.

Love the pattern but not so sure about the yarn. It is slippery like a fish.

Also good to note that the lace band will look like it might make to big of a hat at first but really shrinks a bit when picking up the stitches so trust the sizing in the pattern! I didn’t on my first attempt and had to rip back.
projects.name: Ripley

projects.notes:
The reknit went fast, I finished it. Lovely and oh so soft.

8/23 - Oh crap…just realized I have been using the wrong sized needles! No wonder the damn thing looked small. I will need to frog and reknit. :(
projects.name: Lush Leaves

projects.notes:
Started by me but then will travel to all my friends in the Traveling Scarf Swap in Swapperneckers! I of course will be working on all their scarves too.

I started mine with stash scraps, 300 stitches on US 10.

Scarves I have worked on so far:

FiberKat
Nirethak
weebil
Peacenik
Terasa
KittyRiver
Manderly
Eileenwh
mlledefarge
projects.name: Traveling Scarf

projects.notes: The buttons and the yarn came from different shops on Etsy. This was such a quick knit and I love the results!
projects.name: Shalom Cardigan

projects.notes:
This is a neat pattern and very cute. The worsted size did turn out larger then I was expecting! It was also more knitting then I would have thought and took my longer then I thought.

Still a pretty quick, cute project. The minimal finishing is awesome.

My son named him ChoCoKa. I made him for my friend Kjerstie!
projects.name: ChoCoKa

projects.notes: I whipped up a couple of these for teacher gifts.
projects.name: Mini Mittens!

projects.notes: Note to anyone making the small size that there was a fair bit of yarn left over so it would be totally possible to make these taller if you are not a fan of ankle socks.
projects.name: Mean green socks

projects.notes: 3/3 - I was going to make these knee socks but I think in the interest of finishing these in the next century I am going to just make them regular socks!

projects.notes:
10/25 - The right mitten is finished.

10/31 - I finished the left mitten while waiting in line to vote early but didn’t end up getting to vote because I had a Halloween parade to go to.
projects.name: Cherry Bomb mittens

projects.notes:
I’m going to frog this. This yarn is not right for this project at all and is fighting it big time. I also tried to size this up for my Mother and it is WAY to small. She also wasn’t sure about the style so I am going to go back to browsing patterns to find something that suite her better and would be better for this yarn.

I would like to knit this some day for myself…out of wool and real bulky yarn NOT cotton worsted held double.

Mods:

Cast on 64 stitches and will do one extra level of runching and increase so that the neckline will not be so wide.

194 stitches on the body. Decreases: knit 77 pm knit 40 pm knit 77.

Knitting in the round, cast on 32 stitches to make it even.

projects.name: Solstice Suprise #3 - Wee Mittens
